tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE ArtConservation (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_name VARCHAR(50),
    restoration_process TEXT,
    conservation_notes TEXT,
    historical_context TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE restoration_processes (
 process_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 project_id INT,
 process_description TEXT,
 process_date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE conservation_notes (
 note_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 project_id INT,
 note TEXT,
 note_date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE historical_context (
 context_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 project_id INT,
 event_description TEXT,
 event_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE restoration_projects (
    project_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_name VARCHAR(255),
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    project_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE restoration_notes (
    note_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_id INT,
    note_date DATE,
    note_content TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES restoration_projects(project_id)
);

CREATE TABLE historical_context (
    context_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_id INT,
    era VARCHAR(50),
    historical_facts TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES restoration_projects(project_id)
);

CREATE TABLE conservation_processes (
    process_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_id INT,
    process_name VARCHAR(100),
    process_description TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES restoration_projects(project_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ArtPieces (
    art_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_id INT,
    artist_name VARCHAR(255),
    art_description TEXT,
    creation_date DATE
);
